content: I understand and respect your personal opinion on the matter regarding glorifying organized crime in films. however, it is necessary to consider the principles of freedom of speech and artistic expression, which are fundamental values in democratic societies. indeed, films and other forms of popular media provide a safe way for people to explore and engage with topics that might otherwise be taboo or too difficult to discuss in daily life. but it's also true that society has a responsibility to promote ethical and responsible media, especially when it comes to potentially harmful content such as the portrayal of organized crime. it is also important that these depictions are not used to justify or promote criminal behavior. therefore, viewers should approach these films with a critical eye and consider the real-world implications of their messages.
